titlepage.titleproper: Register of the M. P. (Mariia Petrovna) Bok Papers, 1896-1970
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California

defitem.label: Funding:
defitem.item: Detailed processing and preservation microfilming for these materials were made possible by a generous grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities and by matching funds from the Hoover Institution and Museum of Russian Culture. The grant also provides depositing a microfilm copy in the Hoover Institution Archives. The original materials and copyright to them (with some exceptions) are the property of the Museum of Russian Culture, San Francisco. A transfer table indicating corresponding box and reel numbers is available at the Hoover Institution Archives.

titlepage.p: © 2000 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Memoirs, correspondence, clippings, and photographs, relating to Petr Stolypin.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], M. P. (Mariia Petrovna) Bok Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Daughter of the Russian statesman Petr Stolypin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists mainly of newspaper clippings relating to and photographs of M. P. Bok's father, Petr Arkad'evich Stolypin. There is a small amount of correspondence, as well as biographical material relating to Bok's husband, naval officer Boris Ivanovich Bok.

Detailed processing and preservation microfilming for these materials were made possible by a generous grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities and by matching funds from the Hoover Institution and Museum of Russian Culture. The grant also provides depositing a microfilm copy in the Hoover Institution Archives. The original materials and copyright to them (with some exceptions) are the property of the Museum of Russian Culture, San Francisco. A transfer table indicating corresponding box and reel numbers is available at the Hoover Institution Archives.

The Hoover Institution assumes all responsibility for notifying users that they must comply with the copyright law of the United States (Title 17 United States Code) and Hoover Rules for the Use and Reproduction of Archival Materials.
Letters to M. P. Bok and B. I. Bok arranged alphabetically by correspondent

did.unittitle: Penionzhkevich, Iu., 1965-1966. Includes brochure by Penionzhkevich entitled Zabytyi dolg russkoi emigratsii (São Paolo, 1965)

scopecontent.p: Two versions of M. P. Bok's memoirs, serialized in the Russian émigré press, arranged chronologically

did.unittitle: "Zhizn' P. A. Stolypina: Vospominaniia ob otsie," Vozrozhdenie, 1935-1936. Printed copy
"Iz vospominanii ob otsie," Russkaia zhizn', 1948. Printed copy

scopecontent.p: Materials relating to P. A. Stolypin, arranged alphabetically by physical form

did.unittitle: Scrapbooks. Consist mainly of photographs, but include a brief family history and copies of documents, as well as a handwritten note by Stolypin
Speech on Stolypin by Baron Vladimir Aleksandrovich Barkov, 1930

Miscellany. Includes correspondence of Baron A. F. Meyendorff with Stephen Graham, George Gooch and Richard Enfield, 1949-1950, regarding publication of a biography of Stolypin, as well as fragments of drafts and background materials apparently intended for such a work, reviews of Zen'kovskii's biography, and the program of the 1896 Imperial coronation ceremonies in Moscow

scopecontent.p: Addresses, clippings, and correspondence congratulating B. I. Bok on his 50 years of military service

did.unittitle: Addresses, clippings, and correspondence congratulating B. I. Bok on the 50th anniversary of his commission as a naval officer
